requirement_tested: A responsive frontend interface showcasing a personal portfolio of design works
user_persona: A potential client browsing online portfolios to find a suitable designer.
user_goal: To easily navigate the designer's portfolio website and view key sections.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Maya visits the designer's portfolio website for the first time. She sees a clean header with navigation links and a hero section with the designer's name.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads successfully, displaying a header with 'Home', 'About', 'Portfolio', and 'Contact' links, a hero section, and peach puff background with indian red components.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Sections
narrative_steps.description: Maya wants to jump to the Portfolio section. She clicks the 'Portfolio' link in the header.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Portfolio' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page smoothly scrolls to the Portfolio section without reloading.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Visual Design
narrative_steps.description: As Maya scrolls, she notices consistent styling with peach puff background and indian red accents on buttons and links.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the page styling while scrolling.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All components maintain the correct color scheme with peach puff background and indian red interactive elements.

requirement_tested: A dedicated section displaying detailed information about the designer including background and experience
user_persona: A recruiter looking to evaluate a candidate's design background.
user_goal: To understand the designer's professional journey and qualifications.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing About Section
narrative_steps.description: Jordan navigates to the About section to learn more about the designer's background.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'About' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page scrolls smoothly to the About section showing a profile image on the left and textual content on the right.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Professional Experience
narrative_steps.description: Jordan examines the experience timeline to assess the designer's career progression.
narrative_steps.action: Read through the experience timeline content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A vertical timeline clearly displays roles and dates including 'Senior Designer at Creative Studio (2020-Present)' and 'UI/UX Designer at Digital Agency (2018-2020)'.

requirement_tested: A portfolio browsing feature allowing users to view and navigate through design projects
user_persona: A design enthusiast interested in exploring creative work.
user_goal: To browse through the designer's projects and see detailed information about each one.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Project Gallery
narrative_steps.description: Alex scrolls to the Portfolio section and sees a grid of project thumbnails.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Portfolio section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid layout displays multiple project thumbnails with titles and brief descriptions.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Project Details
narrative_steps.description: Intrigued by one project, Alex clicks on its thumbnail to see more details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a project thumbnail.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal popup appears showing detailed project information including title, full description, technologies used, and links for live demo and source code.

narrative_steps.title: Closing Project View
narrative_steps.description: After reviewing the details, Alex closes the modal to continue browsing.
narrative_steps.action: Click the close button or outside the modal area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The modal closes and Alex returns to the main portfolio grid view.

requirement_tested: A contact section providing clear contact information and methods for reaching the designer
user_persona: A business owner wanting to hire a designer for a new project.
user_goal: To find clear ways to get in touch with the designer.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Contact Information
narrative_steps.description: Sam scrolls to the Contact section to find ways to reach out to the designer.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Contact section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The section displays a clickable email address, social media icons, and a contact form with Name, Email, and Message fields.

narrative_steps.title: Using Social Media Links
narrative_steps.description: Sam prefers to connect via LinkedIn and clicks the LinkedIn icon.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the LinkedIn social media icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new tab opens redirecting to the designer's LinkedIn profile page.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Email Contact
narrative_steps.description: Sam decides to send a direct email and clicks the email link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the email address link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The default email client opens with a new message addressed to the designer.

requirement_tested: Frontend styled with peach puff as the background color and indian red as the primary component color
user_persona: A design student analyzing color choices in web portfolios.
user_goal: To verify that the website consistently uses the specified color scheme throughout.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Taylor inspects the overall page background to confirm the specified color is used.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage and inspect body background.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire page background is consistently colored peach puff as per the theme specification.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Taylor examines interactive elements like buttons and links to ensure they use the correct accent color.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect navigation links and buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive components such as navigation links and buttons use indian red as their primary color.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Hover States
narrative_steps.description: Taylor hovers over navigation links to see if hover effects maintain color consistency.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over navigation links in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigation links show a subtle color change effect while maintaining the overall indian red color scheme.

requirement_tested: Static website structure without dynamic data requirements
user_persona: A developer setting up a new static portfolio website.
user_goal: To ensure the website runs without any backend dependencies or dynamic data fetching.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Website Content
narrative_steps.description: Casey opens the website to verify all content loads directly from static files.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the main index.html page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All content including images, text, and layout load immediately without any API calls or database connections.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Network Activity
narrative_steps.description: Casey opens developer tools to monitor network requests for any dynamic data calls.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser developer tools and monitor Network tab while navigating the site.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: No XHR or fetch requests are made to external APIs or backend services.

requirement_tested: No backend implementation required due to static nature of content
user_persona: A technical reviewer validating the architecture decision.
user_goal: To confirm that no backend services or server-side processing are present.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting File Structure
narrative_steps.description: Morgan reviews the project directory to verify absence of backend code.
narrative_steps.action: Examine project folders and files.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only frontend-related files (HTML, CSS, JS, assets) are present with no backend frameworks or server code.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Runtime Processes
narrative_steps.description: Morgan runs the development server and checks for backend processes.
narrative_steps.action: Run npm run dev and check running processes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only a static file server process is started without any backend server instances.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json with 'install:all' script to install dependencies for both frontend and backend
user_persona: A new team member setting up the development environment.
user_goal: To install all project dependencies with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Installation Script
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clones the repository and needs to install all dependencies quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Execute npm run install:all in the project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed successfully without errors.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json with 'dev' script to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer beginning daily work on the portfolio project.
user_goal: To start the development environment for both frontend and backend simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Riley is ready to begin development and wants to launch both frontend and backend servers.
narrative_steps.action: Execute npm run dev in the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers start concurrently, showing output from each in the terminal.

requirement_tested: Use of environment variables for database connection if dynamic data were needed
user_persona: A DevOps engineer preparing deployment configurations.
user_goal: To verify that database environment variables are properly configured for future use.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Environment Configuration
narrative_steps.description: Casey reviews the project setup to ensure database environment variables are defined.
narrative_steps.action: Examine project configuration files for database environment variables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_NAME are defined with correct values but not actively used.

requirement_tested: Connection to an external PostgreSQL database using specified credentials if dynamic data were needed
user_persona: A backend developer planning for future dynamic features.
user_goal: To verify database connection configuration is properly documented.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Database Configuration
narrative_steps.description: Alex examines how the database connection would be established if backend features were added.
narrative_steps.action: Check documentation and configuration templates for database connection settings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Database connection parameters match the specified credentials (localhost:5432, myappuser/myapppassword, myapp database).

requirement_tested: API integration for fetching dynamic data if the site required it
user_persona: A frontend developer preparing for potential future enhancements.
user_goal: To verify placeholder API integration points exist for future development.

narrative_steps.title: Checking API References
narrative_steps.description: Jordan looks for evidence of planned API integration in the codebase.
narrative_steps.action: Search codebase for API endpoint references.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Comments or placeholder code referencing '/api/data' endpoint exists but is not active.

requirement_tested: Support for real-time preview of content if markdown editing were involved
user_persona: A content creator evaluating portfolio customization options.
user_goal: To verify that markdown content rendering capabilities are available.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Markdown Support
narrative_steps.description: Taylor investigates whether the site supports markdown-formatted content display.
narrative_steps.action: Look for markdown-related CSS or JavaScript files.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Markdown preview stylesheet (/styles/markdown-preview.css) is present in the project assets.

requirement_tested: Interactive elements allowing user engagement with portfolio items
user_persona: A visitor exploring the designer's portfolio website.
user_goal: To interact with various elements on the page to engage with content.

narrative_steps.title: Using Smooth Scroll Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Morgan wants to navigate to different sections of the single-page portfolio.
narrative_steps.action: Click on navigation links in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page smoothly scrolls to the respective sections (About, Portfolio, Contact) without page reload.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Portfolio Items
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks on a portfolio project to see detailed information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a project thumbnail in the Portfolio section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal window opens displaying detailed project information including description and technology tags.

requirement_tested: SEO-friendly page structures for improved visibility of portfolio content
user_persona: A digital marketer checking website optimization.
user_goal: To verify that the website implements proper SEO practices.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Page Metadata
narrative_steps.description: Jordan examines the page head section to check for SEO metadata.
narrative_steps.action: View page source and inspect <head> section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Meta tags including description and structured headings (<h1>, <h2>) are present with relevant content.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Semantic Structure
narrative_steps.description: Jordan verifies that the page uses proper semantic HTML for better search engine indexing.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect HTML structure of main sections.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Content is organized with appropriate semantic tags (header, main, section, article, etc.) and logical heading hierarchy.
